H0.text: who had the most governmental power under the articles of confederation. The People

H1.text: who had the most governmental power under the articles of confederation. The Confederation Congress

H2.text: who had the most governmental power under the articles of confederation. The Committee of the States

H3.text: who had the most governmental power under the articles of confederation. the states

A4.text: Each state retains its sovereignty, freedom, and independence, and every power, jurisdiction, and right, which is not by this Confederation expressly delegated.

A5.text: The absence of a tax base meant that there was no way to pay off state and national debts from the war years except by requesting money from the states, which seldom arrived.
